Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish and label it as an animal.
The student can draw and label the fish's habitat, such as a lake, river, pond, or ocean.
The student can draw and label elements in the habitat that the fish needs, like water and plants.
The student can draw other living things, such as plants or other animals, that might also live in the fish's habitat.
The student can draw and label what the fish needs to survive, like water to swim and food sources.
The student can show how the fish and its habitat work together as a system to meet the fish's needs.
